summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, executed on January 27, 2012. It directs that his entire estate be transferred to The Jeffrey E. Epstein Trust One and appoints Darren K. Indyke, Joseph Pagano, and Lawrence Newman as primary executors, with Jes Staley and Andrew Farkas as successor executors.

events.title: Execution of Epstein's Will
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein signed his last will and testament, witnessed and notarized in New York.

events.title: Creation of The Jeffrey E. Epstein Trust One
events.description: The trust agreement that is the primary beneficiary of Epstein's estate was originally established.

locations: Little St. James Island, United States Virgin Islands
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's entire estate is bequeathed to The Jeffrey E. Epstein Trust One, established in 2001 and amended contemporaneously with the will.
The will appoints three primary executors: Darren K. Indyke, Joseph Pagano, and Lawrence Newman, with Jes Staley and Andrew Farkas as successor executors.
The document includes extensive powers granted to the executors, including broad investment, business operation, and litigation authority, with liability protections.
The will contains a 'no-contest' clause that disinherits any beneficiary who challenges the will or the trust.
The will was executed on January 27, 2012, and notarized by Harry I. Beller in New York County.
